snippet: An appeal to the state Supreme Court was planned after opponents of a requirement for photo identification were denied an injunction.
abstract: Judge Robert Simpson of Pennsylvania, a Republican, declines to block newly enacted state law requiring specific kinds of photo identification to vote; liberal groups, arguing that minorities and the poor would be disproportionately deprived of the ability to vote, say they will appeal to the State Supreme Court to stop the law before the November elections.
lead_paragraph: An appeal to the state Supreme Court was planned after opponents of a requirement for photo identification were denied an injunction.

headline.seo: Pennsylvania Judge Keeps Voter ID Law Intact
headline.main: Pennsylvania Judge Keeps Voter ID Law Intact on Its Way to Higher Court
headline.print_headline: Pennsylvania Judge Keeps Voter ID Law Intact on Its Way to Higher Court
